tools.detailed_description: A Python library for parsing and decoding FIT (Flexible and Interoperable Data Transfer) files, used in sports science and device data logging.

tools.name: simple-tiles
tools.one_line_profile: Library for generating map tiles from geospatial data
tools.detailed_description: A C library for generating map tiles from shapefiles and other geospatial data sources, useful for scientific visualization in GIS.

tools.name: pydicom-deid
tools.one_line_profile: Best effort anonymization for medical images
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for anonymizing DICOM medical images, essential for data privacy in medical research and dataset sharing.

tools.name: pydicom
tools.one_line_profile: Standard Python library for DICOM medical image file IO
tools.detailed_description: A pure Python package for reading, modifying, and writing DICOM files. It is the de facto standard library for handling medical imaging data in Python.

tools.name: pylibjpeg
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for decoding JPEG images in DICOM
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for decoding JPEG images, specifically designed to support pydicom and the various JPEG transfer syntaxes used in medical imaging.

tools.name: pylibjpeg-openjpeg
tools.one_line_profile: JPEG 2000 decoder plugin for pylibjpeg
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for pylibjpeg that provides JPEG 2000 (J2K, JP2, HTJ2K) decoding support using OpenJPEG, critical for handling compressed DICOM medical images.

tools.name: pynetdicom
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of the DICOM networking protocol
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the DICOM networking protocol (Service Class User and Service Class Provider), allowing Python applications to communicate with medical imaging devices and PACS.

tools.name: pysam
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for reading and manipulating genomics data (SAM/BAM/VCF)
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for reading, manipulating, and writing genomic data sets. It is a lightweight wrapper of the HTSlib C-API, supporting SAM, BAM, CRAM, VCF, and BCF formats.

tools.name: feets
tools.one_line_profile: Feature extractor for time series data in astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A library for extracting features from time series data, primarily designed for astronomical light curves.

tools.name: rt-utils
tools.one_line_profile: Library for creating and manipulating DICOM RTStructs
tools.detailed_description: A minimal Python library to facilitate the creation and manipulation of DICOM RTStruct (Radiotherapy Structure Set) files, used in medical physics and radiation therapy.

tools.name: sf
tools.one_line_profile: Simple Features for R - Spatial data analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides support for simple features, a standardized way to encode spatial vector data. It allows for manipulation, analysis, and visualization of spatial data.

tools.name: RADTorch
tools.one_line_profile: Medical Imaging Machine Learning Framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed for medical imaging machine learning tasks, facilitating data loading, processing, and model training for radiology applications.

tools.name: Rasters.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Raster data manipulation for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for manipulating and analyzing raster data, supporting various file formats and geospatial operations.

tools.name: rasterio
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for reading and writing geospatial raster datasets
tools.detailed_description: Rasterio reads and writes geospatial raster datasets (like GeoTIFF) using GDAL, providing a Pythonic API for raster data processing.

tools.name: pydicom-seg
tools.one_line_profile: Library for DICOM-SEG medical segmentation file IO
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for reading and writing DICOM-SEG (Segmentation) objects, facilitating the handling of medical image segmentation results.

tools.name: NIFTI-Reader-JS
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript NIfTI file format reader
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for reading NIfTI (Neuroimaging Informatics Technology Initiative) file formats, enabling web-based visualization and processing of neuroimaging data.

tools.name: segmentation-eval
tools.one_line_profile: Radiomics evaluation for liver cancer tumors from DICOM
tools.detailed_description: A tool to extract and evaluate radiomics features for liver cancer tumors using DICOM segmentation masks, integrating SimpleITK and PyRadiomics.

tools.name: clisops
tools.one_line_profile: Library for subsetting, averaging and regridding climate simulation data
tools.detailed_description: A python library for running data-reduction operations on climate simulation data (NetCDF), typically used in the ROOCS (Remote Operations On Climate Simulations) framework.

tools.name: MODIStsp
tools.one_line_profile: Automated download and preprocessing of MODIS Land Products
tools.detailed_description: An R package that automates the creation of time series of rasters derived from MODIS Land Products data, performing download, mosaicking, reprojection and resizing.

tools.name: dcm2niix
tools.one_line_profile: Robust DICOM to NIfTI converter for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A popular tool to convert DICOM images from medical scanners (MRI, CT) to the NIfTI format used by scientific analysis tools like FSL, SPM, and AFNI.

tools.name: FitFileParser
tools.one_line_profile: Swift library for parsing Garmin FIT files
tools.detailed_description: A Swift package that provides functionality to parse FIT (Flexible and Interoperable Data Transfer) files, commonly used in sports science and physiological data logging.

tools.name: terra
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial data analysis and manipulation in R
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive R package for spatial data analysis, replacing the 'raster' package. It supports raster and vector data manipulation, including reading/writing various geospatial formats.

tools.name: rust-htslib
tools.one_line_profile: High-level Rust bindings for HTSlib
tools.detailed_description: Provides a high-level Rust API for reading and writing high-throughput sequencing data formats (BAM, BCF, VCF, etc.) via HTSlib.

tools.name: htslib
tools.one_line_profile: C library for high-throughput sequencing data formats
tools.detailed_description: The core C library for parsing and manipulating high-throughput sequencing data formats such as SAM, BAM, CRAM, and VCF. It is the foundation for samtools and bcftools.

tools.name: samtools
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for manipulating NGS data (SAM/BAM/CRAM)
tools.detailed_description: A suite of programs for interacting with high-throughput sequencing data. It provides tools for converting, sorting, indexing, and viewing data in SAM/BAM/CRAM formats.

tools.name: mo_netcdf
tools.one_line_profile: Modern Fortran wrapper for NetCDF
tools.detailed_description: A library providing an object-oriented, modern Fortran interface to the NetCDF C library, simplifying IO operations in climate and weather models.

tools.name: zarr-rust
tools.one_line_profile: Rust implementation of the Zarr storage format
tools.detailed_description: A pure Rust implementation of the Zarr V3 specification, enabling high-performance N-dimensional array storage and retrieval, critical for cloud-native scientific data.

tools.name: scippnexus
tools.one_line_profile: NeXus file handling with Scipp integration
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides an h5py-like interface for reading NeXus files (common in neutron/X-ray scattering) directly into Scipp data structures.

tools.name: astrolibpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python port of IDL astronomy library
tools.detailed_description: A collection of astronomical utility codes ported from the classic IDL astrolib, providing various calculations and data handling functions for astronomers.

tools.name: SeqAn
tools.one_line_profile: C++ template library for sequence analysis
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance C++ library for the analysis of biological sequences, providing algorithms and data structures for string matching, alignment, and IO.

tools.name: bio2zarr
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for bioinformatics formats to Zarr
tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert standard bioinformatics file formats (like VCF and PLINK) into Zarr archives, facilitating cloud-based analysis and efficient storage.

tools.name: WOSS
tools.one_line_profile: World Ocean Simulation System
tools.detailed_description: A framework that integrates underwater channel simulators (like Bellhop) with network simulators, automating the use of environmental data for underwater acoustic simulations.

tools.name: h5grove
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for serving HDF5 file content
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing utilities to design backends for serving HDF5 file content (attributes, metadata, data) efficiently, often used for web-based visualization.

tools.name: hdf5plugin
tools.one_line_profile: HDF5 compression filters for h5py
tools.detailed_description: Provides a set of HDF5 compression filters (Blosc, LZ4, Zstandard, etc.) for use with h5py, enabling reading and writing of compressed HDF5 data.

tools.name: rust-fitsio
tools.one_line_profile: Rust bindings for CFITSIO
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library providing a wrapper around the CFITSIO C library, allowing Rust programs to read and write FITS files used in astronomy.

tools.name: garmin_wrapped
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization scripts for Garmin FIT data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts to parse, analyze, and visualize running data from Garmin .fit and .txt files, enabling fine-grained performance analysis.

tools.name: astroimtools
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical image convenience tools
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing convenience tools for processing astronomical images, including cutouts and simple arithmetic, developed by STScI.

tools.name: gwcs
tools.one_line_profile: Generalized World Coordinate System
tools.detailed_description: A library for managing the Generalized World Coordinate System (GWCS), providing a flexible way to map pixel coordinates to world coordinates in astronomy.

tools.name: imexam
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive image examination and plotting
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for simple interactive image examination and plotting, providing functionality similar to IRAF's imexamine task.

tools.name: jwql
tools.one_line_profile: James Webb Space Telescope Quicklook Application
tools.detailed_description: A software suite for monitoring the health and stability of the JWST instruments and data products, providing quicklook visualization and analysis.

tools.name: stsynphot
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic photometry for HST and JWST
tools.detailed_description: An extension of synphot providing synthetic photometry utilities specifically for Hubble Space Telescope (HST) and James Webb Space Telescope (JWST).

tools.name: synphot
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic photometry using Astropy
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose package for synthetic photometry in astronomy, allowing users to simulate observations and calculate photometric properties.

tools.name: JGribX
tools.one_line_profile: Java GRIB-1/GRIB-2 decoder
tools.detailed_description: A Java library for decoding GRIB-1 and GRIB-2 files, which are standard formats for meteorological data.

tools.name: fitparse-rs
tools.one_line_profile: Rust library to parse FIT formatted files
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library for parsing FIT (Flexible and Interoperable Data Transfer) files, providing access to data records and definitions.

tools.name: Optika
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for simulating and designing optical systems
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for simulating optical systems, offering functionality similar to Zemax for ray tracing and optical design analysis.

tools.name: ndcube
tools.one_line_profile: Library for handling multi-dimensional coordinate-aware arrays in solar physics
tools.detailed_description: A base package for multi-dimensional contiguous and non-contiguous coordinate-aware arrays, primarily designed for solar physics data analysis.

tools.name: SunPy
tools.one_line_profile: Core library for Solar Physics data analysis
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software library for solar physics data analysis, providing tools for querying, downloading, and analyzing solar data.

tools.name: sunraster
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to analyze solar spectral data
tools.detailed_description: A SunPy-affiliated package providing tools to analyze spectral data from various solar missions.

tools.name: dicom (Go)
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance DICOM medical image parser in Go
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance library written in Go for parsing and processing DICOM medical image files.

tools.name: AGStoShapefile
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to convert ArcGIS Server Map Services to GeoJSON/Shapefile
tools.detailed_description: A utility to query ArcGIS Server Dynamic Map Services and convert the output into standard geospatial formats like GeoJSON and Shapefile.

tools.name: gdal2tiles
tools.one_line_profile: Library for generating map tiles from GDAL-supported rasters
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for generating map tiles (TMS) based on the gdal2tiles.py utility from the GDAL project, facilitating geospatial data visualization.

tools.name: scipdf_parser
tools.one_line_profile: Parser for extracting content and figures from scientific PDF publications
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to parse scientific PDF articles, extracting metadata, text content, and figures, useful for scientific text mining and analysis.

tools.name: Argos
tools.one_line_profile: GUI viewer for HDF5, NetCDF4, and other scientific data formats
tools.detailed_description: A data viewer application capable of reading and inspecting HDF5, NetCDF4, and other common scientific file formats.

tools.name: nii2dcm
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for converting NIfTI medical images to DICOM format
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to convert NIfTI (Neuroimaging Informatics Technology Initiative) files into DICOM series.

tools.name: bio-vcf
tools.one_line_profile: DSL and parser for filtering and processing VCF files
tools.detailed_description: A smart parser and Domain Specific Language (DSL) for processing, filtering, and rewriting VCF (Variant Call Format) files in bioinformatics.

tools.name: vcflib
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library and tools for manipulating VCF files
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive C++ library and collection of command-line tools for parsing, manipulating, and analyzing VCF files.

tools.name: virtual-tiff
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to create virtual Zarr stores from TIFF files
tools.detailed_description: A utility to produce and explore virtual Zarr stores backed by TIFF files, enabling cloud-optimized access patterns without data duplication.

tools.name: Vitessce
tools.one_line_profile: Visual integration tool for spatial single-cell experiments
tools.detailed_description: A visual integration tool for exploration of spatial single-cell experiment data, supporting various bio-imaging formats.

tools.name: SeqLib
tools.one_line_profile: C++ interface for querying and manipulating sequence data
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library providing an interface to htslib, bwa-mem, and fermi for efficient interrogation and manipulation of sequencing data (BAM/CRAM/FASTQ).

tools.name: ogr2ogr-wrapper
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper library for the ogr2ogr geospatial conversion tool
tools.detailed_description: A TypeScript/JavaScript wrapper around the ogr2ogr command-line tool, facilitating geospatial data format conversion within Node.js applications.

tools.name: pydl
tools.one_line_profile: Library of IDL astronomy routines converted to Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing common astronomy routines originally written in IDL, facilitating migration and data analysis in Python.

tools.name: zen3geo
tools.one_line_profile: Library for geospatial data IO and processing
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to simplify geospatial data input/output and processing tasks.

tools.name: wradlib
tools.one_line_profile: Library for weather radar data processing
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for processing weather radar data, including reading, correcting, and visualizing radar data formats.

tools.name: xcube
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for generating and exploiting Earth observation data cubes
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for generating, manipulating, and analyzing data cubes from Earth observation data, leveraging xarray, dask, and zarr.

tools.name: xtensor-zarr
tools.one_line_profile: C++ implementation of the Zarr core protocol
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library implementing the Zarr core protocol (v2 and v3) based on the xtensor library, enabling efficient multidimensional array storage.

tools.name: ArchGDAL.jl
tools.one_line_profile: High-level Julia API for GDAL
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing a high-level interface to the GDAL (Geospatial Data Abstraction Library) for reading and writing geospatial data formats.

tools.name: OvertureMapsDownloader
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for downloading and processing Overture Maps data
tools.detailed_description: A tool that simplifies the acquisition and manipulation of geospatial data from Overture Maps using DuckDB, Dask, and GDAL.

tools.name: VirtualiZarr
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to cloud-optimize scientific data as Virtual Zarr stores
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to create virtual Zarr stores from existing data files, enabling cloud-optimized access via xarray syntax without data duplication.

tools.name: pydantic-zarr
tools.one_line_profile: Pydantic models for Zarr data structures
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing Pydantic models for validating and defining Zarr data structures and metadata.

tools.name: zarr-java
tools.one_line_profile: Java implementation of the Zarr Specification for N-dimensional arrays
tools.detailed_description: A Java library providing an implementation of the Zarr specification, enabling storage and retrieval of chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays. It serves as a core IO library for Java-based scientific applications requiring Zarr format support.

tools.name: zarr-python
tools.one_line_profile: Reference Python implementation of chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays
tools.detailed_description: The official Python implementation of the Zarr format, providing an interface for chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays. It is widely used in genomics, bioimaging, and geospatial sciences for handling large-scale scientific datasets.

tools.name: zarrs
tools.one_line_profile: Rust library for the Zarr storage format
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Rust library for creating, reading, and manipulating Zarr V3 and V2 data. It provides core IO capabilities for multidimensional arrays and metadata in the Rust ecosystem.

tools.name: zarrs-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for the zarrs Rust crate
tools.detailed_description: Provides a high-performance CodecPipeline for zarr-python, backed by the zarrs Rust library. It accelerates Zarr data processing in Python environments by leveraging Rust's performance.

tools.name: ZnH5MD
tools.one_line_profile: High Performance Interface for H5MD Trajectories
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface designed for high-performance reading and writing of H5MD (HDF5 for Molecular Dynamics) files. It facilitates the handling of large-scale molecular dynamics trajectory data.

tools.name: zarr-ml
tools.one_line_profile: OCaml implementation of the Zarr storage format
tools.detailed_description: An OCaml library implementing the Zarr specification for chunked and compressed multidimensional arrays, enabling scientific data IO in the OCaml ecosystem.
